name: Slow Cooker Mediterranean Lentil Soup
author: Diana Moutsopoulos
summary: My family is from Greece and this lentil soup recipe is adapted from my traditional Greek lentil soup (fakes) recipe. Since becoming a mom finding time to cook has been hard and this soup was a perfect slow cooker candidate. My husband and I think it tastes better than when made on the stove. Baby loves it, too!
ingredients: salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Place lentils in a medium saucepan, cover with water, and bring to a boil
Boil for 10 minutes, drain well, and add to the slow cooker
Combine olive oil, carrots, red onion, tomato paste, garlic, oregano, bay leaves, salt, and pepper in the slow cooker and cover with about 6 to 7 cups of water
Cook on Low until lentils are soft, 6 to 8 hours
